instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message: Hey guys got an interesting one in. This device powers on and works normally, but the keyboard and trackpad are not recognized in the OS. The power button does work on any keyboard I try to turn the machine on and off, but no matter what keyboard or trackpad I use, the machine will come up with the bluetooth keyboard and trackpad notification on screen searching for a keyboard and trackpad. I have no reason to believe this device had liquid damage as the board looks really clean, and the keys and trackpad do not feel sticky nor look corroded. I see in the schematic that the power for the Tpad and keyboard comes from the CPU then goes to the USB hub then to the controller IC for the tpad and keyboard, and then finally to the keyboard and tpad. The connectors for both look flawless no burned test points or vias. Where do I start on troubleshooting this? I'm guessing <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> is ok as i do get a light on a USB mouse for both USB ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message: I do have 3.3 volts on <SIGNAL>TPAD_VBUS_EN</SIGNAL> on pin 4 of <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message: Btw if <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> is bad, can I pull it from say an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? The chips look almost the same a few numbers are different, but the name of the chip is the same CY8C24794

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message:
Can you get into boot menu with ALT key? Tried a known good trackpad+cable?

<CHIP>U5701</CHIP> has firmware and is different from MBP boards. Will work from retina boards 2012/13.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message: Have tried cable and tpad with new one and no change does not light up the caps lock key nor move mouse cursor. Have not tried alt key yet I do know the only key to work for me so far is the power button but will try to use alt tomorrow. And thanks for info on <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> will order donors for this one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message: Ok so alt key doesn't work either. No key on the keyboard for me actually does anything besides the power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Keyboard or Trackpad recognized in the OS.
threads.message: You can close this one. Customer for the repair shop who sent it in was a major b i t c h. Didn't wanna pay anything to fix it lol probably for the better we didn't do anything to it yet.
